sen.j: 大伴 弟麻呂（おおとも の おとまろ、天平3年（731年）? - 大同 (日本)4年5月28日 (旧暦)（809年7月14日））は、奈良時代・平安時代初期の公卿・武将。
sen.e: OTOMO no Otomaro (731-July 14,809) was a Kugyo (high court noble) and busho (Japanese military commander) in Nara and the early Heian period.
OTOMO no Otomaro (731? - July 18, 809) was a Kugyo (high court noble) and busho (Japanese military commander) in Nara and the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: ?補足しました。スペース補足しました、グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。
sen.e: OTOMO no Otomaro (731? - July 18, 809) was a Kugyo (high court noble) and busho (Japanese military commander) in Nara and the early Heian period.

sen.j: 史料上の初代征夷大将軍。
sen.e: He was the first Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader in the historical materials.
He was the first Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) in the historical materials.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。)補足しました。Seii Taishogunに訂正しました。
sen.e: He was the first Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader) in the historical materials.

sen.j: 生年は神亀4年（727年）とも言われる。
sen.e: One theory said he was born in 727.
One theory said he was born in 727.
One theory said he was born in 727.

sen.j: 大伴古慈斐の子か（『公卿補任』）。
sen.e: It is likely his father was OTOMO no Koshibi.
It is likely his father was OTOMO no Koshibi ("Kugyobunin" [directory of court nobles]).
sen.cmt: （『公卿補任』）訳漏れ。補足しました。
sen.e: It is likely his father was OTOMO no Koshibi ("Kugyobunin" [directory of court nobles]).
His name was written also in another kanji (Chinese characters) 乙麻呂 (Otomaro).
His name was written also in another kanji (Chinese characters) 乙麻呂 (Otomaro).
His name was written also in another kanji (Chinese characters) 乙麻呂 (Otomaro).
It is likely in 731?

sen.j: - 大伴古慈斐の子として生まれるか。
sen.e: He was born to OTOMO no Koshibi.
He was born to OTOMO no Koshibi.
He was born to OTOMO no Koshibi.
He was assigned as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was assigned as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was assigned as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
In March 780.
On March, 780:
On March, 780:
He was assigned as emon no suke (assistant captain of Outer Palace Guards).
He was assigned as emon no suke (assistant captain of Outer Palace Guards).
He was assigned as emon no suke (assistant captain of Outer Palace Guards).
He was assigned as Chugu no suke; Chugu no suke (Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) and Saejinosuke (assistant captain of Left Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 左衛士佐（定訳不明でした。）
sen.e: He was assigned as Chugu no suke; Chugu no suke (Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) and Saeji no suke (assistant captain of Left Palace Guards).

sen.e: He was assigned as Chugu no suke; Chugu no suke (Assistant Master of the Consort's Household) and Saeji no suke (assistant captain of Left Palace Guards).
He was assigned as Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was assigned as Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: He was assigned as Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
He was assigned as Hitachi no suke.
He was assigned as Hitachi no suke.
He was assigned as Hitachi no suke.
He was assigned concurrently as Seito vice-shogun.
He was assigned concurrently as Seito vice-shogun.
He was assigned concurrently as Seito vice-shogun.
He was assigned as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was assigned as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was assigned as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was assigned as seii taishi (great general who subdues the barbarians).
He was assigned as seii taishi (great general who subdues the barbarians).
He was assigned as seii taishi (great general who subdues the barbarians).
He was given setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission).
He was given setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission).
He was given setto (a sword given by the emperor in the symbol of his trust to the appointment of someone to a mission).

sen.j: - 征夷大将軍に就任し、坂上田村麻呂と共に蝦夷を征討する。
sen.e: He assumed as Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader),subjugating Ezo (northerners) along with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
He assumed as Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader), subjugating Ezo (northerners) along with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。Seii Taishogunに訂正しました。
sen.e: He assumed as Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader), subjugating Ezo (northerners) along with SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.

sen.j: - 戦功により従三位・勲二等を叙せられる。
sen.e: He was given Jusani (Junior Third Rank) Order of Second Class.
He was given Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Order of Second Class.
sen.cmt: Jusanmiに訂正しました。and補足しました。
sen.e: He was given Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and Order of Second Class.
